text: Add a search icon on the far right of the Execute bar. Clicking on the icon expands it into a search bar. The user can then type into the search bar to see the tickets displayed be live filtered (in addition to the existing status filter). Once in input mode, the search icon should change to an "X" - clicking the X clears the search and defocuses and hides the search input, reverting back to the original state of just the search icon.

proposedTasks.title: Add expandable search bar to Execute phase toolbar
proposedTasks.description:
Add a search icon to the far-right of the Execute tab's top bar (alongside the existing status filter). Clicking the icon expands it into a text input search bar with smooth animation. While expanded, the icon changes to an 'X' close button. Clicking 'X' clears the search query, defocuses the input, and collapses back to the icon-only state. The search input should have placeholder text (e.g. 'Search tickets') and auto-focus when expanded.

Acceptance criteria:
- Search icon renders on the far right of the Execute toolbar
- Clicking the icon expands into a text input with transition animation
- Icon changes to 'X' when input is visible
- Clicking 'X' clears input value, hides the input, and reverts to icon state
- Input receives focus automatically on expand
- Pressing Escape also closes/clears the search bar
- Works alongside the existing status filter without layout conflicts

proposedTasks.title: Implement live ticket filtering by search query in Execute phase
proposedTasks.description:
Wire the search bar input to a live filter over the displayed tickets in the Execute phase epic cards. As the user types, tickets should be filtered in real-time (debounced ~150ms) matching against ticket title and description. The filter composes with the existing status filter (both must match for a ticket to display). Epic cards with zero matching tickets should be hidden. The match count in each epic card's progress summary (e.g. '3/8 tasks done') should reflect filtered results or show an indicator that filtering is active.

Acceptance criteria:
- Typing in the search bar filters displayed tickets in real-time
- Filtering is case-insensitive and matches against ticket title and description
- Search filter composes with the existing status filter (AND logic)
- Epic cards with no matching tickets are hidden while search is active
- Clearing the search (via X or Escape) restores the full unfiltered view
- No perceptible lag  input is debounced at ~150ms
- Unit tests cover filter logic for title match, description match, combined filters, empty results, and clear behavior

taskTitles: Add expandable search bar to Execute phase toolbar
Implement live ticket filtering by search query in Execute phase
